Author: runpaint#7773
Content: Anyone else having an issue creating an AtomicDEX trade, in which the "amount to receive" field won't accept more than 7 digits?

Author: runpaint#7773
Content: So far I've only experienced it when I sold Doge and Qtum for COMMOD.  The issue wasn't present when I sold ETH, LTC, USDC, RVN, KMD, BAT, and VRSC for COMMOD.

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Recently, if I try to take the entire amount on order for a particular coin (actually VRSC) the swap does not match and fails at 0/3.  If I take slightly less than the full amount everything is fine. However this is only true for large amounts.  If there is a small amount on offer (like less than one VRSC) then I am able to take the full amount without problem

Author: runpaint#7773
Content: I've found a workaround: if your order total is more than 7 digits, just create 10 orders which are each 1-tenth the size.  It worked.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> can i use that explorer to view completed swaps?
 whether a swap is complete or not is known to only the maker and taker
it can also be found by analysing the involved blockchains

what the website here: `https://oracle.earth/mm2_orderbook/` shows is the orderbook
the orderbook is constructed by each marketmaker node locally based on the info they hear on the network
offers are only broadcasted by makers till they are unfulfilled
